Job description:
GetYourGuide is searching for a Staff Data Analyst to join our Marketing Analytics team.

The Marketing Analytics team's objective is to help our marketing scale our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. This is a very strategic position within the team as the Analyst will look at solving cross-channel problems in order to accelerate our growth. This means for example addressing the best strategy to grow our mid-funnel spend and understanding the behaviour of our repeat audiences.
Duties and responsibilities:
Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions

Propose and defend strategic recommendations to our top marketing leads

Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)

Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders

Setup and analyse marketing experiments to drive strategic decision making

Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team

Mentor others in the skills needed for this role
Appreciated qualification and experience:
8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role

Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)

Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders

Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing, especially data-driven platforms such as Google Ads and Meta

Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)

Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals

Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Job description: At GetYourGuide, we're looking for a passionate Senior Data Scientist to join our Traveler Data Products Team. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our product and our customers' experiences. You'll work with a vast and diverse set of structured and unstructured data, powering various data products such as search, recommendations, SEM, and incentives. Our team has touchpoints across the business, developing end-to-end solutions that directly contribute to creating memorable travel experiences for people around the world.
Duties and responsibilities:
Develop innovative data products that not only delight our customers but also drive the success of our company.

Take full ownership of projects, guiding them from the initial business challenge to the deployment of production code. This includes:
- Analyzing large datasets to uncover meaningful insights
- Building and maintaining robust data pipelines
- Monitoring and optimizing data products after deployment

Contribute to the development of our machine learning infrastructure and help establish best practices that will shape our future.

Work closely with cross-functional teams, leveraging your unique perspective to solve complex and exciting problems.

Support the continuous improvement and growth of our team, including participating in recruiting efforts to bring in new talent.
Appreciated qualification and experience:
Machine Learning Familiarity with regressors, classifiers, and recommender systems. A solid understanding of ML techniques and their practical applications. Experience deploying ML models in production is a must. Experience with LLMs in a production environment is beneficial.

Software Engineering Proficiency in Python. Knowledge of distributed machine learning and computing frameworks (e.g., Spark) is beneficial.

Analytics Ability to transform data into actionable insights. Experience with hypothesis testing and proficiency in analytics tools (e.g., pandas, R) and SQL.

Business Acumen Applied experience in a business environment, demonstrating result-driven work.

Academic Background An advanced degree in a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.

Communication Strong skills in explaining complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Job title: Lead Product Manager, Traveler Data Products
Job description:
As a Lead Product Manager, you will have significant ownership and be responsible for defining a vision and strategy that impacts multiple product areas and teams within GetYourGuide. You will have an executive presence to gain buy-in and influence the company's long-term vision. In this role, you will execute complex projects that require multiple Product and Business teams that depend on you to achieve their goals.

On the Traveler Data Products team, you will enable our customers to discover products they will love. Your team consists of experienced data scientists and engineers tackling this challenge in an algorithmic way, mainly by applying techniques from machine learning and AI. You will also work closely with other product teams to leverage AI in ways that directly impact the traveler experience. You will be responsible for a critical part of our customer experience that also drives business success.

Join our team as a visionary leader, where your passion for data products and enthusiasm for artificial intelligence will be the driving force behind shaping the future of supply optimization at GetYourGuide. We seek an inspiring and dynamic individual who is ready to harness the power of AI to transform our operations, innovate boldly, and lead us into a new era of efficiency and excellence.
Duties and responsibilities:
Ownership: Develop and implement a comprehensive strategy for your product area, set clear, measurable goals, and take full responsibility for outcomes. Drive sustained impact through a long-term (12 months+) roadmap, identifying areas for non-incremental impact.

Ambiguity: Proactively navigate and clarify ambiguous situations, breaking down complex problems into manageable tasks. Making confident decisions even with incomplete information and independently identifying opportunities for significant impact.

Communication: Articulate and connect your product area’s strategy to the company’s mission. Break down the strategy into actionable steps, regularly update stakeholders on progress, and create excitement for your long-term vision.

Prioritization: Analyze user feedback, market trends, and business metrics to inform decision-making. Prioritize initiatives, re-evaluate the roadmap based on new insights, and ensure the most valuable features are delivered first. Make strategic decisions on sequencing and prioritizing product work to maximize impact and learning.

Collaboration: Build trust with various stakeholders, set clear expectations, and align them with your product area’s roadmap. Facilitate cross-functional collaboration and create buy-in across the organization. Influence laterally and upward to build support for product initiatives, motivating and engaging your team and other important stakeholder groups.

Experimentation: Plan and execute experiments to test hypotheses, develop A/B tests, and analyze data to derive actionable insights. Leverage experimentation to evaluate your team's investment and inform future product decisions.

Leadership: Represent user interests at all levels of the organization. Act openly and transparently with your team, peers, and executive leadership. Provide coaching and mentorship to other team members, helping them grow and develop their skills.
Appreciated qualification and experience:
6+ years of professional experience in data science-oriented product management and at least 2+ as a Lead Product Manager

Demonstrated ownership over multiple product areas in a previous role, including responsibilities for strategy, KPI setup, goal-setting, and execution of roadmap

Ability to build alignment with a cross-functional mission team and a large set of stakeholders in a collaborative way that is aligned with our Guiding Principles

Excellent data analytics skills with the ability to derive insights from large data sets

Demonstrated passion for driving customer and business impact

Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Job description:
At dltHub, we're building on the success of dlt, the most popular open-source library for data loading in Python with over 2 million monthly downloads. After proving its value in the OSS community, we’re now building our commercial offering, dltHub, to make data engineering accessible to all Python developers.

Our team is based in Berlin, now growing into other locations, especially across the US. Founded by experienced data and ML engineers, we're backed by Foundation Capital, Dig Ventures, and technical founders from Hugging Face, Instana, Matillion, Miro, MotherDuck, Datadog, Mode, and Rasa.

We're building a new service, ground-up, that brings together the `dlt` library, an LLM-first development workspace, and data lake storage and runtime for data pipelines and notebooks. This takes our stack beyond Python into new languages, infrastructure, and systems and we’re looking to grow the team with people who bring required skills and background. Our focus is on deeply understanding user needs and developing the best technologies to meet them. To make that happen, we’re looking for smart, driven people that, with time, will take ownership of key parts of the product.
Duties and responsibilities:
- Design and implement our commercial product. This involves both writing Python code and listening to our customers, who are running sophisticated data platforms we augment.
- You’ll be on top of recent trends in how data platforms are built and will be able to serve as a technical expert or architect. You’ll work closely with our Solution Engineering team and help them solve real-world problems our customers face.
- Contribute to the dlt open source core, including code, tests, and documentation
- Maintain the open source project with the team (e.g., review PRs, resolve issues, talk with community contributors, write docs, etc.)
Appreciated qualification and experience:
Here’s the stack we use (or plan to use) so you can quickly see if it’s a good fit for you. Strong Python knowledge is essential. You don’t need to know everything listed, but if you’re confident in any of the areas below, we’d love to hear from you:
- Python/OSS/backend: pyarrow, duckdb (data processing), ibis (data querying), data frame libraries like polars, fastapi/starlette. Rust for optimizations.
- Frontend/UI: next.js/react, Marimo/Streamlit/Jupyter (Python)
- Storage tech: DuckLake, Iceberg, Parquet, bucket storage
- Runtime infra: Docker, Kubernetes, AWS/AZURE/GCP
